name: bbn\Db\Internal\Shortcuts

tfn.name: tfn

arguments.name: escaped
arguments.description: If set to true the returned string will be escaped.

params.name: $escaped
params.description: If set to true the returned string will be escaped.

tfn.comments:
/**
   * Return table's full name.
   * (similar to {@link table_full_name()})
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->tfn("table_users"));
   * // (string) work_db.table_users
   * X::dump($db->tfn("table_users", true));
   * // (string) `work_db`.`table_users`
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $table   The table's name
   * @param bool   $escaped If set to true the returned string will be escaped.
   * @return null|string
   */

tsn.name: tsn

arguments.name: escaped
arguments.description: If set to true the returned string will be escaped.

params.name: $escaped
params.description: If set to true the returned string will be escaped.

tsn.comments:
/**
   * Return table's simple name.
   * (similar to {@link table_simple_name()})
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->tsn("work_db.table_users"));
   * // (string) table_users
   * X::dump($db->tsn("work_db.table_users", true));
   * // (string) `table_users`
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $table   The table's name
   * @param bool   $escaped If set to true the returned string will be escaped.
   * @return null|string
   */

cfn.name: cfn

arguments.name: escaped
arguments.description: If set to true the returned string will be escaped.

params.name: $escaped
params.description: If set to true the returned string will be escaped.

cfn.comments:
/**
   * Return column's full name.
   * (similar to {@link col_full_name()})
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->cfn("name", "table_users"));
   * // (string)  table_users.name
   * X::dump($db->cfn("name", "table_users", true));
   * // (string) \`table_users\`.\`name\`
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $col     The column's name (escaped or not).
   * @param string|null $table   The table's name (escaped or not).
   * @param bool   $escaped If set to true the returned string will be escaped.
   * @return null|string
   */

csn.name: csn

arguments.name: col
arguments.description: The column's complete name (escaped or not)

arguments.name: escaped
arguments.description: If set to true the returned string will be escaped.

params.name: $col
params.description: The column's complete name (escaped or not)

params.name: $escaped
params.description: If set to true the returned string will be escaped.

csn.comments:
/**
   * Return the column's simple name.
   * (similar to {@link col_simple_name()})
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->csn("table_users.name"));
   * // (string) name
   * X::dump($db->csn("table_users.name", true));
   * // (string) `name`
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $col     The column's complete name (escaped or not)
   * @param bool   $escaped If set to true the returned string will be escaped.
   * @return null|string
   */

dummyComments:
/**
   * Return table's full name.
   * (similar to {@link table_full_name()})

   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->tfn("table_users"));
   * // (string) work_db.table_users
   * X::dump($db->tfn("table_users", true));
   * // (string) `work_db`.`table_users`
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $table   The table's name
   * @param bool   $escaped If set to true the returned string will be escaped.
   * @return null|string

/**
   * Return table's simple name.
   * (similar to {@link table_simple_name()})
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->tsn("work_db.table_users"));
   * // (string) table_users
   * X::dump($db->tsn("work_db.table_users", true));
   * // (string) `table_users`
   * ```
   *

/**
   * Return column's full name.
   * (similar to {@link col_full_name()})
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->cfn("name", "table_users"));
   * // (string)  table_users.name
   * X::dump($db->cfn("name", "table_users", true));
   * // (string) \`table_users\`.\`name\`
   * ```
   *
   * @param string $col     The column's name (escaped or not).
   * @param string|null $table   The table's name (escaped or not).
   * @param bool   $escaped If set to true the returned string will be escaped.
   * @return null|string
   */

/**
   * Return the column's simple name.
   * (similar to {@link col_simple_name()})
   *
   * ```php
   * X::dump($db->csn("table_users.name"));
   * // (string) name

   * // (string) `name`
